submission:
nimasile = ["#", "7", "77", "5", "77", "7", "caonimade", "4", "44", "6", "44", "4", "caonimade",]

class Solution:
    def largestPalindrome(self, n: int, k: int) -> str:
        if k == 1 or k == 3 or k == 9: return "9" * n
        if k == 2: 
            if n == 1: return "8"
            if n == 2: return "88"
            return "8" + "9" * (n - 2) + "8"
        if k == 4:
            if n == 1: return "8"
            if n == 2: return "88"
            if n == 3: return "888"
            
            return "88" +(n-4) * "9" + "88"
        if k == 8:
            if n <= 6:
                return "8" * n
            return "888" + "9" * (n - 6) + "888" 
        if k == 5:
            if n == 1: return "5"
            if n == 2: return "55"
            return "5" + "9" * (n - 2) + "5"
        if k == 6:
            if n == 1: return "6"
            if n == 2: return "66"
            if n == 3: return "888"
            if n % 2 == 0:
                nine = (n - 4) // 2
                return "8" +'9'*nine + "77"+'9'*nine + "8"
            else:
                wocaonima = (n - 3) // 2 * "9"
                return "8" + wocaonima + "8" + wocaonima + "8"
        if k == 7:
            if n == 1: return "7"
            if n == 2: return "77"
            if n == 3: return "959"
            if n == 4: return "9779"
            if n == 5: return "99799"
            if n == 6: return "999999"
            if n == 7: return "9994999"
            if n % 6 == 0: return "9" * n
            c = n % 12
            fill = nimasile[c]
            if len(fill) == 2:
                f = (n - 2) // 2
                return "9" * f + fill + "9" * f 
            else:
                f = (n - 1) // 2
                return "9" * f + fill + "9" * f
